title.narrative: Assistance to the Government of Sri Lanka to Address the Immediate and Mid-Term Needs of the Sri Lankan Migrant Workers in Line with the National COVID-19 Response Plan for Migrant Workers

description.narrative: Sri Lankan migrant workers in the Middle East are amongst those most impacted due to COVID-19. Approximately 97.4% of domestic workers and 78% of low-skilled category workers are concentrated in the Middle East. Many migrant workers have lost their employment and are in crowded shelters managed by the Sri Lankan embassies, which pose several health risks. Further, undocumented migrant workers are reportedly being denied health care and are being subjected to detention/ deportation. Lack of repatriation options push migrants, particularly women, into vulnerable or exploitative situations. Stretched social services, with limited ability to meet the specific needs of stranded and/or vulnerable migrants such as rights protection, documentation support, and assisted voluntary return. Against this background and at the request of the Sri Lankan Government to support repatriation of migrant workers standard abroad, the project will ensure stranded migrants and migrant returnees have access to timely, context-specific and correct information on COVID-19 prevention measures. Vulnerable stranded migrant workers will have improved access to protection, and assistance services in host countries and migrants who are unable or unwilling to remain in their host countries and wish to return to Sri Lanka will receive support related to their return.
